title: You want to connect with experts in your field
desc: share your knowledge online, the more you give, the more others will share with you

title: Someone told you that you are full of ego, and you want to do something with that
desc: never tell your story like you are a hero, most of the time that is useless for the listener

title: You're bored of a lot of stupid productivity frameworks and want only one book to summarize everything of this kind
desc: umm that's already straightforward

title: You have an idol, someone you look up to and want to imitate some cool parts of them
desc: read, watch, do things that person does, first you have to start finding those things

title: When you want to brainstorm to start a project with your friends, most of the time it ends up with awkward situations
desc: divide the brainstorm phase into two sub-phases, the first one is to focus on quantity, and next to screen some quality ideas

title: You think what you read in the above link is still not enough?
desc: trust me, this activity works

title: You want to know how industrial engineers boost the productivity of factories
desc: this is a playlist by Kruploy, one of the best teachers in my life

title: You are skeptical in behavioral science/economics/finance
desc: if you cut everything impractical out, the thing left from those fancy academic ideas is "how to create an incentive/manipulate people without them noticing", only read the fourth point

title: You want to get an A in calculus but don't care if you really get the concepts or not / don't have a strong high school math background
desc: this one is already straightforward

title: You are a developer in Bangkok, Thailand, and you want to make friends
desc: go to Creatorsgarten event

title: You want to know how serious Asian high school clubs operate
desc: watch Hibike Euphonium, based on my experience with that kind of club that is very accurate

title: You think your life has no meaning, and you love reading Japanese novels
desc: short happy life is a lot better than long suffering life, so you might try more to find your own meaning

title: You want to know how to read research papers
desc: never read every page of the paper if you are not 100% sure that it will be useful, most of the time it is useless to do that

title: You haven't learned all of the physics you were supposed to in school
desc: just learn with the Theoretical Minimum series, you will not be as competent as the people who graduate with their undergrad in physics, but you will know more than average people for sure

title: You want to get started with aerospace engineering by yourself, but not sure how
desc: this blog contains a lot of useful information that even some technology institutes reference a lot of know-how from this blog

title: You enjoy Richard Nakka's blog but are looking for more practical tips on rocket building
desc: for example, when attaching fins to a rocket, you might want to use alcohol

title: You have some kind of mental breakdown from some unacceptable event
desc: just don't give a f*** and only control what can be controlled, it's easy to say but hard to do, so you have to do a lot of exercises at the end of the book

title: You are interested in quantitative finance and want to know how to get started, and you also live in Thailand
desc: join QuantCorner event or Quant CU if you are studying at Chulalongkorn University, people at the event might be able to give you some ideas to get started

title: You want to be more friendly, but you are an introvert
desc: just create a chance to listen more and speak less

title: You want to get an idea of what data science really is
desc: you will start with the most basic concept, linear regression

title: You want to get started on how to create a very basic economic model
desc: use your intuition on what variables are related to the dependent variable you're interested in, and put it in the formula

title: You know that at the core of the design thinking framework is to have a lot of talk with the customer, but you are not proficient in interviewing people yet
desc: many wrong questions can provide you with wrong insights, causing you to lose time and money, and that is preventable if we practice how to interview in the first place

title: You're looking for something to listen to at the gym or while running
desc: the Lex Fridman podcast is a great choice. It offers insights into what top experts across various fields are doing

title: You want to get access to paid research papers
desc: paste the DOI from the paper into Sci-Hub

title: You want a paid book without paying money
desc: use LibGen

title: You tried LibGen and didn't find the book
desc: use Anna's Archive instead

title: You want to see some great engineering work by a high school student
desc: This paper is probably the most impactful one of my life—it’s what made me decide to join the aerospace engineering club during my high school years

title: You want to be a passionate statistics student
desc: read how statistics is being used to lie professionally

title: You want to read a behavioral economics book which is purely based on research papers with academic fraud
desc: psychology of lying is interesting, especially in a book that is based on papers created by lying

title: You want to build your first personal website, and you don't have bias against using WordPress
desc: this tutorial is great, but if you are not a writer type of person, this won't be worth it

title: You want to do some engineering projects, so you want to get started with 3D modeling stuff
desc: my mechanical engineer friend recommended me this

title: You want to become a web developer
desc: here is a pool of resources by my web dev friend

title: You want to know what is at the frontier of STEM stuff
desc: an intelligent physics lecturer I know recommended us this channel

title: You want to know why I created this page
desc: I listened to this interview and was impressed by the advice of "you should try to be useful"

title: You want to know the basics of how to code but currently have no clear project in mind
desc: Python is a great start; it is something like a generalist language—it can do many tasks, just not the best at any one thing

title: You want to start reading textbooks
desc: don't read it like a novel

title: You want to see some practical DATA-DRIVEN COMPANY
desc: by After Yum

title: You want some wedding invitation card inspiration
desc: hope you are an academic

title: You want to know what someone will do if he already gets enough money to live his whole life and wants to live his life to be as happy as possible
desc: Sivers writing is sharp
